The present disclosure relates to various aspects, and includes at least the following aspects.

[Aspect 1] A nanoemulsion composition of oxygen gas sustained release, including a water phase part containing water; and an oil phase part dispersed in the water phase part and made of nanoparticle containing a perfluorocarbon compound, wherein the oil phase part contains oxygen gas, and the oxygen gas is released in sustained release.
[Aspect 2] In the composition of aspect 1, an average diameter of the nanoparticle is 100 nm to 300 nm.
[Aspect 3] In the composition of aspect 1 or 2, the oxygen gas is collected in an amount of 1 ppm (v/w) to 35 ppm (v/w) based on a total weight of the nanoemulsion composition.
[Aspect 4] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 3, the perfluorocarbon compound is a perfluoroalkyl halide.
[Aspect 5] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 4, the perfluorocarbon compound is a perfluorooctylbromide (PFOB).

[Aspect 6] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 5, the perfluorocarbon compound is one or more of a chain perfluorinated aliphatic hydrocarbon of 1 to 12 carbon atoms and a cyclic perfluorinated aliphatic hydrocarbon of 3 to 12 carbon atoms having 1 or 2 rings.

[Aspect 7] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 6, the perfluorocarbon compound is a combination of the chain perfluorinated aliphatic hydrocarbon of 1 to 12 carbon atoms and the cyclic perfluorinated aliphatic hydrocarbon of 3 to 12 carbon atoms having 1 or 2 rings.
[Aspect 8] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 7, the perfluorocarbon compound is one or more of perfluorodecalin (PFD) and perfluorohexane (PFH).

[Aspect 9] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 8, the perfluorocarbon compound is a combination of perfluorodecalin (PFD) and perfluorohexane (PFH), and a content ratio of the perfluorodecalin (PFD) and the perfluorohexane (PFH) is 6:1 to 1:3 by weight.
[Aspect 10] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 9, a content of the perfluorocarbon compound is 5 to 80% by weight based on a total weight of the nanoemulsion composition.

[Aspect 11] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 10, the nanoemulsion composition further comprises one or more of phospholipid, polyglycerin stearic acid ester and fatty acid ester of sorbitan as a main surfactant, the nanoemulsion composition further comprises one or more of cholesterol, glyceryl diester, inulin fatty acid ester, polyglycerin lauric acid ester, carboxylate salt of glutamic acid, and fatty acid ester of ethoxylated sorbitan as auxiliary surfactant.

[Aspect 12] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 11, a total content of the main surfactant and the auxiliary surfactant is 0.1 to 10% by weight based on a total weight of the nanoemulsion composition.
[Aspect 13] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 12, a content ratio of the main surfactant and the auxiliary surfactant is 10:1 to 1:3 by weight.

[Aspect 14] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 13, the phospholipid is one or more selected from the group consisting of hydrogenated lecithin and phosphatidylcholine, the polyglycerol stearic acid ester is polyglyceryl-10 stearate, and the fatty acid ester of sorbitan is sorbitan monooleate (Span 80).

[Aspect 15] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 14, the glyceryl diester is glyceryl stearate citrate, the inulin fatty acid ester is inulin lauryl carbamate, the polyglycerin lauric acid ester is polyglyceryl-10 laurate, the carboxylate salt of glutamic acid is sodium stearoyl glutamate, and the fatty acid ester of the ethoxylated sorbitan is PEG-20 sorbitan monooleate (Tween 80).
[Aspect 16] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 15, a concentration of the oxygen gas reaches equilibrium at 10 seconds or more after the composition starts dissolution.
[Aspect 17] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 16, the composition prevents hair loss or promotes hair growth.
[Aspect 18] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 17, an additional active ingredient for hair loss prevention or hair growth promotion is further included.
[Aspect 19] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 18, the composition has a formulation for external application to skin.
[Aspect 20] In the composition of any one of aspects 1 to 19, the composition is a cosmetic composition, a pharmaceutical composition or a food composition.

[Aspect 21] A method for preparing the composition according to any one of aspects 1 to 19, comprising the steps of preparing a first mixture by mixing water, oil; one or more of the phospholipid, the polyglycerin stearic acid ester and the fatty acid ester of sorbitan as the main surfactant; and one or more of the cholesterol, the glyceryl diester, the inulin fatty acid ester, the polyglycerin lauric acid ester, the carboxylate salt of glutamic acid, and the fatty acid ester of ethoxylated sorbitan as the auxiliary surfactant; preparing a second mixture by adding the perfluorocarbon compound to the first mixture; preparing a crude emulsion by homogenizing the second mixture; and bubbling the oxygen into the crude emulsion.

Although the present invention has been described with reference to the above-mentioned preferred embodiments, various modifications and variations are possible without departing from the spirit and scope of the invention. Accordingly, it is intended that the appended claims cover such modifications and variations as fall within the scope of the present invention.

claim.claim-text: 1. A nanoemulsion composition of oxygen gas sustained release, comprising:a water phase part containing water; andan oil phase part dispersed in the water phase part and made of nanoparticle containing a perfluorocarbon compound,wherein the oil phase part contains oxygen gas, and the oxygen gas is released in sustained release.
2. The composition according to claim 1, wherein an average diameter of the nanoparticle is 100 nm to 300 nm.
3. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the oxygen gas is collected in an amount of 1 ppm (v/w) to 35 ppm (v/w) based on a total weight of the nanoemulsion composition.
4. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the perfluorocarbon compound is a perfluoroalkyl halide or a perfluorooctylbromide (PFOB).

5. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the perfluorocarbon compound is one or more of a chain perfluorinated aliphatic hydrocarbon of 1 to 12 carbon atoms and a cyclic perfluorinated aliphatic hydrocarbon of 3 to 12 carbon atoms having 1 or 2 rings.

6. The composition according to claim 5, wherein the perfluorocarbon compound is a combination of the chain perfluorinated aliphatic hydrocarbon of 1 to 12 carbon atoms and the cyclic perfluorinated aliphatic hydrocarbon of 3 to 12 carbon atoms having 1 or 2 rings.
7. The composition according to claim 5, wherein the perfluorocarbon compound is one or more of perfluorodecalin (PFD) and perfluorohexane (PFH).

8. The composition according to claim 6, wherein the perfluorocarbon compound is a combination of perfluorodecalin (PFD) and perfluorohexane (PFH), and a content ratio of the perfluorodecalin (PFD) and the perfluorohexane (PFH) is 6:1 to 1:3 by weight.
9. The composition according to claim 1, wherein a content of the perfluorocarbon compound is 5 to 80% by weight based on a total weight of the nanoemulsion composition.

10. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the nanoemulsion composition further comprises one or more of phospholipid, polyglycerin stearic acid ester and fatty acid ester of sorbitan as a main surfactant, the nanoemulsion composition further comprises one or more of cholesterol, glyceryl diester, inulin fatty acid ester, polyglycerin lauric acid ester, carboxylate salt of glutamic acid, and fatty acid ester of ethoxylated sorbitan as auxiliary surfactant.
11. The composition according to claim 10, wherein a total content of the main surfactant and the auxiliary surfactant is 0.1 to 10% by weight based on a total weight of the nanoemulsion composition.
12. The composition according to claim 10, wherein a content ratio of the main surfactant and the auxiliary surfactant is 10:1 to 1:3 by weight.

13. The composition according to claim 10, wherein the phospholipid is one or more selected from the group consisting of hydrogenated lecithin and phosphatidylcholine, the polyglycerin stearic acid ester is polyglyceryl-10 stearate, and the fatty acid ester of sorbitan is sorbitan monooleate (Span 80).

14. The composition according to claim 10, wherein the glyceryl diester is glyceryl stearate citrate, the inulin fatty acid ester is inulin lauryl carbamate, the polyglycerin lauric acid ester is polyglyceryl-10 laurate, the carboxylate salt of glutamic acid is sodium stearoyl glutamate, and the fatty acid ester of the ethoxylated sorbitan is PEG-20 sorbitan monooleate (Tween 80).
15. The composition according to claim 1, wherein a concentration of the oxygen gas reaches equilibrium at 10 seconds or more after the composition starts dissolution.
16. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the composition has a formulation for external application to skin.
17. The composition according to claim 1, wherein the composition is a cosmetic composition, a pharmaceutical composition or a food composition.
18. A method for preventing hair loss or promoting hair growth comprising administering an effective amount of the composition according to claim 1 to a subject in need thereof.
19. The method according to claim 18, the composition further comprises an additional active ingredient for hair loss prevention or hair growth promotion.

20. A method for preparing the composition according to claim 1, comprising the steps of:preparing a first mixture by mixing water, oil; one or more of the phospholipid, the polyglycerin stearic acid ester and the fatty acid ester of sorbitan as the main surfactant; and one or more of the cholesterol, the glyceryl diester, the inulin fatty acid ester, the polyglycerin lauric acid ester, the carboxylate salt of glutamic acid, and the fatty acid ester of ethoxylated sorbitan as the auxiliary surfactant;preparing a second mixture by adding the perfluorocarbon compound to the first mixture;preparing a crude emulsion by homogenizing the second mixture; andbubbling the oxygen into the crude emulsion.
